newsitem.title: UK: Boutros-Ghali pledges to fight for second term.
newsitem.headline: Boutros-Ghali pledges to fight for second term.

text.p: United Nations Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali has vowed to defy U.S. resistance and fight to the bitter end for a second term.
"I want to be re-elected to be able to continue the reform," he said in an interview with Britain's Independent newspaper published on Tuesday.
"I believe that my departure would create more problems for this institution because you need the continuity at this particular period," he added.
Boutros-Ghali defended his tenure, citing as successes the establishment of peace in El Salvador and Mozambique as well as the adoption of a zero-growth U.N. budget.
He said the U.N. floundered in Bosnia because it was asked to defend safe havens without the 34,000-strong force he had asked for and he blamed the international community for the shortfall.
Boutros-Ghali said many governments had taken their eye off international affairs.
"You find this new provincialism, neo-isolation. The great majority of the member states are not interested in international affairs. This is the real problem we face."
